qstack.spahm.compute_spahm module¶

qstack.spahm.compute_spahm.get_guess_dm(mol, guess, xc='pbe', openshell=None)¶

Compute the density matrix with the guess Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • guess (funct) – Method used to compute the guess Hamiltonian. Output of get_guess.

  • xc (str) – Exchange-correlation functional. Defaults to pbe

  • openshell (bool) – . Defaults to None.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the density matrix computed using the guess Hamiltonian.

qstack.spahm.compute_spahm.get_guess_orbitals(mol, guess, xc='pbe')¶

Compute the guess Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • guess (funct) – Method used to compute the guess Hamiltonian. Output of get_guess.

  • xc (str) – Exchange-correlation functional. Defaults to pbe.

Returns:

A 1D numpy array containing the eigenvalues and a 2D numpy array containing the eigenvectors of the guess Hamiltonian.

qstack.spahm.compute_spahm.get_spahm_representation(mol, guess_in, xc='pbe')¶

Compute the SPAHM representation.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • guess_in (str) – Method used to obtain the guess Hamiltoninan.

  • xc (str) – Exchange-correlation functional. Defaults to pbe.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the SPAHM representation.

qstack.spahm.guesses module¶

qstack.spahm.guesses.GWH(mol, *_)¶

Uses the generalized Wolfsberg-Helmholtz to compute the guess Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the computed approximate Hamiltonian.

qstack.spahm.guesses.LB(mol, *_)¶

Uses the Laikov-Briling model with HF-based parameters to compute the guess Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the computed approximate Hamiltonian.

qstack.spahm.guesses.LB_HFS(mol, *_)¶

Laikov-Briling using HFS-based parameters

Parameters:

mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the computed approximate Hamiltonian.

qstack.spahm.guesses.SAD(mol, func)¶

Uses the superposition of atomic densities to compute the guess Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • func (str) – Exchange-correlation functional.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the computed approximate Hamiltonian.

qstack.spahm.guesses.SAP(mol, *_)¶

Uses the superposition of atomic potentials to compute the guess Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the computed approximate Hamiltonian.

qstack.spahm.guesses.get_dm(v, nelec, spin)¶

Computes the density matrix.

Parameters:

  • v (numpy ndarray) – Eigenvectors of a previously solve Hamiltoinan.

  • nelec (tuple) – Number of alpha and beta electrons.

  • spin (int) – Spin.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the density matrix computed using the guess Hamiltonian.

qstack.spahm.guesses.get_guess(arg)¶

Returns the function of the method selected to compute the approximate hamiltoninan

Parameters:

arg (str) – Approximate Hamiltonian

Returns:

The function of the selected method.

qstack.spahm.guesses.get_occ(e, nelec, spin)¶

Computes the occupancy.

Parameters:

  • e (numpy ndarray) – Energy eigenvalues.

  • nelec (tuple) – Number of alpha and beta electrons.

  • spin (int) – Spin.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the occupancy.

qstack.spahm.guesses.hcore(mol, *_)¶

Uses the diagonalization of the core to compute the guess Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the computed approximate Hamiltonian.

qstack.spahm.guesses.solveF(mol, fock)¶

Computes the eigenvalues and eigenvectors corresponding to the given Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • fock (numpy ndarray) – Approximate Hamiltonian.
